member.name: P:AlphaTab.Audio.Synth.IAlphaSynth.IsReady
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the synthesizer is ready for interaction. (output and worker are initialized)

members.member: Gets or sets whether the synthesizer is ready for playback. (output, worker are initialized, soundfont and midi are loaded) p

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Audio.Synth.IAlphaSynth.State
member.summary: Gets the current player state.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Audio.Synth.IAlphaSynth.LogLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the loging level.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Audio.Synth.IAlphaSynth.MasterVolume
member.summary: Gets or sets the current master volume as percentage. (range: 0.0-3.0, default 1.0)

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Audio.Synth.IAlphaSynth.MetronomeVolume
member.summary: Gets or sets the metronome volume. (range: 0.0-3.0, default 0.0)

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Audio.Synth.IAlphaSynth.PlaybackSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the current playback speed as percentage. (range: 0.125-8.0, default: 1.0)

member.summary: Gets or sets the position within the song in midi ticks.

member.summary: Gets or sets the position within the song in milliseconds.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Audio.Synth.IAlphaSynth.PlaybackRange
member.summary: Gets or sets the range of the song that should be played. Set this to null to play the whole song.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Audio.Synth.IAlphaSynth.IsLooping
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the playback should automatically restart after it finished.

member.summary: Starts the playback if possible

member.name: M:AlphaTab.Audio.Synth.IAlphaSynth.Pause
member.summary: Pauses the playback if was running

member.summary: Starts the playback if possible, pauses the playback if was running

member.summary: Stopps the playback

member.summary: Gets the sample rate required by the output.

member.name: M:AlphaTab.Audio.Synth.ISynthOutput.Open
member.summary: Called when the output should be opened.

member.name: M:AlphaTab.Audio.Synth.ISynthOutput.SequencerFinished
member.summary: Called when the sequencer finished the playback. This tells the output not to request any samples anymore after the existing buffers are finished.

member.name: M:AlphaTab.Audio.Synth.ISynthOutput.Play
member.summary: Called when the output should start the playback.

member.name: M:AlphaTab.Audio.Synth.ISynthOutput.Pause
member.summary: Called when the output should stop the playback.

member.summary: Called when samples have been synthesized and should be added to the playback buffer.

member.name: M:AlphaTab.Audio.Synth.ISynthOutput.ResetSamples
member.summary: Called when the samples in the output buffer should be reset. This is neeed for instance when seeking to another position.

member.name: E:AlphaTab.Audio.Synth.ISynthOutput.Ready
member.summary: Fired when the output has been successfully opened and is ready to play samples.

member.name: E:AlphaTab.Audio.Synth.ISynthOutput.SamplesPlayed
member.summary: Fired when a certain number of samples have been played.

member.name: E:AlphaTab.Audio.Synth.ISynthOutput.SampleRequest
member.summary: Fired when the output needs more samples to be played.

member.name: E:AlphaTab.Audio.Synth.ISynthOutput.Finished
member.summary: Fired when the last samples after calling SequencerFinished have been played.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Audio.Synth.MidiFileSequencer
member.summary: This sequencer dispatches midi events to the synthesizer based on the current synthesize position. The sequencer does not consider the playback speed.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Audio.Synth.MidiFileSequencer._currentTime
member.remarks: Note that this is not the actual playback position. It's the position where we are currently synthesizing at. Depending on the buffer size of the output, this position is after the actual playback.

member.summary: Sets the zoom level of the rendered notation

member.summary:
The engine which should be used to render the the tablature.
default - Platform specific default engine
html5 - HTML5 Canvas
svg - SVG

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Settings.Layout
member.summary: The layout specific settings

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Settings.ImporterSettings
member.summary:
Specific settings for importers. Keys are specific for the importers. MusicXML
musicxmlMergePartGroups - If part-groups should be merged into a single track (boolean, default:false)

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Settings.StretchForce
member.summary: The default stretch force to use for layouting.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Settings.ForcePianoFingering
member.summary: Forces the fingering rendering to use always the piano finger stýle where fingers are rendered as 1-5 instead of p,i,m,a,c and T,1,2,3,4.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Settings.Staves
member.summary: The staves that should be shown in the music sheet. This is one of the profiles registered in the

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Settings.TranspositionPitches
member.summary: The transposition pitch offsets for the individual tracks. They apply to rendering and playback.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Settings.DisplayTranspositionPitches
member.summary: The transposition pitch offsets for the individual tracks. They apply to rendering only.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Settings.LogLevel
member.summary: The log level to use within alphaTab

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Settings.SmallGraceTabNotes
member.summary: If set to true the guitar tabs on grace beats are rendered smaller.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Settings.ExtendBendArrowsOnTiedNotes
member.summary: If set to true bend arrows expand to the end of the last tied note of the string. Otherwise they end on the next beat.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Settings.ShowParenthesisForTiedBends
member.summary: If set to true the note heads on tied notes will have parenthesis if they are preceeded by bends.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Settings.ShowTabNoteOnTiedBend
member.summary: If set to true a tab number will be shown in case a bend is increased on a tied note.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Settings.BendMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the bend mode to use for display and playback of bends.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Settings.WhammyMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the whammy mode to use for display and playback of whammys.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Settings.FingeringMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the fingering mode to use.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Settings.ShowZeroOnDiveWhammy
member.summary: If set to true, 0 is shown on dive whammy bars.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Settings.ExtendLineEffectsToBeatEnd
member.summary: If set to true, line effects (like w/bar, let-ring etc) are drawn until the end of the beat instead of the start.

member.summary: This is a global counter for all beats. We use it at several locations for lookup tables.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.WhammyType
member.summary: Lists all types of whammy bars

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Model.WhammyType.None
member.summary: No whammy at all

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Model.WhammyType.Custom
member.summary: Individual points define the whammy in a flexible manner. This system was mainly used in Guitar Pro 3-5

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Model.WhammyType.Dive
member.summary: Simple dive to a lower or higher note.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Model.WhammyType.Dip
member.summary: A dive to a lower or higher note and releasing it back to normal.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Model.WhammyType.Hold
member.summary: Continue to hold the whammy at the position from a previous whammy.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Model.WhammyType.Predive
member.summary: Dive to a lower or higher note before playing it.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Model.WhammyType.PrediveDive
member.summary: Dive to a lower or higher note before playing it, then change to another note.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.Beat
member.summary: A beat is a single block within a bar. A beat is a combination of several notes played at the same time.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Model.Beat.GlobalBeatId
member.summary: This is a global counter for all beats. We use it at several locations for lookup tables.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Model.Beat.DisplayStart
member.summary: The timeline position of the voice within the current bar as it is displayed. (unit: midi ticks)
member.remarks: This might differ from the actual playback time due to special grace types.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Model.Beat.PlaybackStart
member.summary: The timeline position of the voice within the current bar as it is played. (unit: midi ticks)
member.remarks: This might differ from the actual playback time due to special grace types.

member.name: M:AlphaTab.Model.Beat.IsBefore(AlphaTab.Model.Beat)
member.summary: Checks whether the current beat is timewise before the given beat.

member.name: M:AlphaTab.Model.Beat.IsAfter(AlphaTab.Model.Beat)
member.summary: Checks whether the current beat is timewise after the given beat.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.BendPoint
member.summary: A single point of a bending graph. Used to describe WhammyBar and String Bending effects.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.BrushType
member.summary: Lists all types of how to brush multiple notes on a beat.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.Chord
member.summary: A chord definition.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Model.Chord.FirstFret
member.summary: Indicates the first fret of the chord diagram.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Model.Chord.Strings
member.summary: Gets or sets the frets played on the individual strings for this chord. - The order in this list goes from the highest string to the lowest string. - -1 indicates that the string is not played.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Model.Chord.BarreFrets
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of frets where the finger should hold a barre

member.summary: This public enumeration lists all supported Clefs.

member.summary: Lists all durations of a beat.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.KeySignatureType

member.summary: The maximum alternate endings. (1 byte with 8 bitflags)

The fermata.

member.summary: Gets the fermata for a given beat.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.ModelUtils
member.summary: This public class contains some utilities for working with model public classes

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.NoteAccidentalMode
member.summary: Lists the modes how accidentals are handled for notes

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Model.NoteAccidentalMode.Default
member.summary: Accidentals are calculated automatically.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Model.NoteAccidentalMode.SwapAccidentals
member.summary: If the default behavior calculates a Sharp, use flat instead (and vice versa).

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Model.NoteAccidentalMode.ForceNatural
member.summary: This will move the note one line down and applies a Naturalize.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Model.NoteAccidentalMode.ForceSharp
member.summary: This will move the note one line down and applies a Sharp.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Model.NoteAccidentalMode.ForceFlat
member.summary: This will move the note one line up and applies a Flat.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.BendStyle
member.summary: Lists the different bend styles

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Model.BendStyle.Default
member.summary: The bends are as described by the bend points

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Model.BendStyle.Gradual
member.summary: The bends are gradual over the beat duration.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Model.BendStyle.Fast
member.summary: The bends are done fast before the next note.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.BendType
member.summary: Lists all types of bends

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Model.BendType.None
member.summary: No bend at all

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Model.BendType.Custom
member.summary: Individual points define the bends in a flexible manner. This system was mainly used in Guitar Pro 3-5

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Model.BendType.Bend
member.summary: Simple Bend from an unbended string to a higher note.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Model.BendType.Release
member.summary: Release of a bend that was started on an earlier note.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Model.BendType.BendRelease
member.summary: A bend that starts from an unbended string, and also releases the bend after some time.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Model.BendType.Hold
member.summary: Holds a bend that was started on an earlier note

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Model.BendType.Prebend
member.summary: A bend that is already started before the note is played then it is held until the end.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Model.BendType.PrebendBend
member.summary: A bend that is already started before the note is played and bends even further, then it is held until the end.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Model.BendType.PrebendRelease
member.summary: A bend that is already started before the note is played and then releases the bend to a lower note where it is held until the end.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.Note
member.summary: A note is a single played sound on a fretted instrument. It consists of a fret offset and a string on which the note is played on. It also can be modified by a lot of different effects.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Model.Note.GlobalNoteId
member.summary: This is a global counter for all notes. We use it at several locations for lookup tables.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Model.Note.String
member.summary: Gets or sets the string number where the note is placed. 1 is the lowest string on the guitar and the bottom line on the tablature. It then increases the the number of strings on available on the track.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Model.Note.RealValue
member.summary: Gets the absolute value of this note for playback.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Model.Note.DisplayValue
member.summary: Gets the absolute value of this note considering offsets by bends and ottavia

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Model.Note.DisplayValueWithoutBend
member.summary: Gets the absolute value of this note considering all effects beside bends.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Model.Note.HasQuarterToneOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the note has a offset of a quartertone caused by bends.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.Ottavia
member.summary: Lists all ottavia.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.PickStrokeType
member.summary: Lists all types of pick strokes.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.PlaybackInformation
member.summary: This public class stores the midi specific information of a track needed for playback.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.RepeatGroup
member.summary: This public class can store the information about a group of measures which are repeated

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Model.RepeatGroup.MasterBars
member.summary: All masterbars repeated within this group

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Model.RepeatGroup.Openings
member.summary: a list of masterbars which open the group.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Model.RepeatGroup.Closings
member.summary: a list of masterbars which close the group.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Model.RepeatGroup.IsOpened
member.summary: true if the repeat group was opened well

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Model.RepeatGroup.IsClosed
member.summary: true if the repeat group was closed well

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.RenderStylesheet
member.summary: This class represents the rendering stylesheet. It contains settings which control the display of the score when rendered.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.Score
member.summary: The score is the root node of the complete model. It stores the basic information of a song and stores the sub components.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Model.Score.Album
member.summary: The album of this song.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Model.Score.Artist
member.summary: The artist who performs this song.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Model.Score.Copyright
member.summary: The owner of the copyright of this song.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Model.Score.Instructions
member.summary: Additional instructions

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Model.Score.Music
member.summary: The author of the music.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Model.Score.Notices
member.summary: Some additional notes about the song.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Model.Score.SubTitle
member.summary: The subtitle of the song.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Model.Score.Title
member.summary: The title of the song.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Model.Score.Words
member.summary: The author of the song lyrics

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Model.Score.Tab
member.summary: The author of this tablature.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.Section
member.summary: This public class is used to describe the beginning of a section within a song. It acts like a marker.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.SlideType
member.summary: This public enum lists all different types of finger slides on a string.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.StaffKind
member.summary: Represents the different kinds of staffs.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.Staff
member.summary: This class describes a single staff within a track. There are instruments like pianos where a single track can contain multiple staffs.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Model.Staff.TranspositionPitch
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of semitones this track should be transposed. This applies to rendering and playback.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Model.Staff.DisplayTranspositionPitch
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of semitones this track should be transposed. This applies only to rendering.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Model.Staff.Tuning
member.summary: Get or set the guitar tuning of the guitar. This tuning also indicates the number of strings shown in the guitar tablature. Unlike the property this array directly represents the order of the tracks shown in the tablature. The first item is the most top tablature line.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.Track
member.summary: This public class describes a single track or instrument of score. It is bascially a list of staffs containing individual music notation kinds.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.TripletFeel
member.summary: This public enumeration lists all feels of triplets.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.Tuning
member.summary: This public class represents a predefined string tuning.

members.member: Checks if the given string is a tuning inticator. Checks if the given string is a tuning inticator.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.VibratoType
member.summary: This public enum lists all vibrato types that can be performed.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Model.Voice
member.summary: A voice represents a group of beats that can be played during a bar.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.BarRendererBase
member.summary: This is the base public class for creating blocks which can render bars.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.BarRendererBase.IsLinkedToPrevious
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this renderer is linked to the next one by some glyphs like a vibrato effect

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.BarRendererBase.CanWrap
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this renderer can wrap to the next line or it needs to stay connected to the previous one. (e.g. when having double bar repeats we must not separate the 2 bars)

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.BarRendererBase.TopPadding
member.summary: Gets the top padding for the main content of the renderer. Can be used to specify where i.E. the score lines of the notation start.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.BarRendererBase.BottomPadding
member.summary: Gets the bottom padding for the main content of the renderer. Can be used to specify where i.E. the score lines of the notation end.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.BeatXPosition
member.summary: Lists the different position modes for

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.BeatXPosition.PreNotes
member.summary: Gets the pre-notes position which is located before the accidentals

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.BeatXPosition.OnNotes
member.summary: Gets the on-notes position which is located after the accidentals but before the note heads.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.BeatXPosition.MiddleNotes
member.summary: Gets the middel-notes position which is located after in the middle the note heads.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.BeatXPosition.PostNotes
member.summary: Get the post-notes position which is located at after the note heads.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.BeatXPosition.EndBeat
member.summary: Get the end-beat position which is located at the end of the beat. This position is almost equal to the pre-notes position of the next beat.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.BarRendererFactory
member.summary: This is the base public class for creating factories providing BarRenderers

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.EffectBarGlyphSizing
member.summary: Lists all sizing types of the effect bar glyphs

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.EffectBarGlyphSizing.SinglePreBeat
member.summary: The effect glyph is placed above the pre-beat glyph which is before the actual note in the area where also accidentals are renderered.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.EffectBarGlyphSizing.SingleOnBeat
member.summary: The effect glyph is placed above the on-beat glyph which is where the actual note head glyphs are placed.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.EffectBarGlyphSizing.SingleOnBeatToEnd
member.summary: The effect glyph is placed above the on-beat glyph which is where the actual note head glyphs are placed. The glyph will size to the end of the applied beat.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.EffectBarGlyphSizing.GroupedBeforeBeat
member.summary: The effect glyph is placed above the on-beat glyph and expaded to the on-beat position of the next beat.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.EffectBarGlyphSizing.GroupedOnBeat
member.summary: The effect glyph is placed above the on-beat glyph and expaded to the on-beat position of the next beat.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.EffectBarGlyphSizing.GroupedOnBeatToEnd
member.summary: The effect glyph is placed above the on-beat glyph and expaded to the on-beat position of the next beat. The glyph will size to the end of the applied beat.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.EffectBarGlyphSizing.FullBar
member.summary: The effect glyph is placed on the whole bar covering the whole width

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.EffectBarRenderer
member.summary: This renderer is responsible for displaying effects above or below the other staves like the vibrato.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.Glyphs.EffectGlyph
member.summary: Effect-Glyphs implementing this public interface get notified as they are expanded over multiple beats.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.Glyphs.EffectGlyph.Beat
member.summary: Gets or sets the beat where the glyph belongs to.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.Glyphs.EffectGlyph.NextGlyph
member.summary: Gets or sets the next glyph of the same type in case the effect glyph is expanded when using .

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.Glyphs.EffectGlyph.PreviousGlyph
member.summary: Gets or sets the previous glyph of the same type in case the effect glyph is expanded when using .

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.Glyphs.Glyph
member.summary: A glyph is a single symbol which can be added to a GlyphBarRenderer for automated layouting and drawing of stacked symbols.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.Glyphs.GlyphGroup
member.summary: This glyph allows to group several other glyphs to be drawn at the same x position

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.Glyphs.GroupedEffectGlyph.IsLinkedWithPrevious
member.summary: Gets a value whether this glyph is linked with a previous glyph for rendering. This means this glyph will not be rendered itself, but rendered as part of the very first glyph of this link-group.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.Glyphs.GroupedEffectGlyph.IsLinkedWithNext
member.summary: Gets a value whether this glyph is linked with the next glyph for rendering.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.Glyphs.SpacingGlyph
member.summary: This simple glyph allows to put an empty region in to a BarRenderer.

member.name: M:AlphaTab.Rendering.Glyphs.TieGlyph.PaintTie(AlphaTab.Platform.ICanvas,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Boolean,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: paints a tie between the two given points

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.Glyphs.VoiceContainerGlyph
member.summary: This glyph acts as container for handling multiple voice rendering

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.IEffectBarRendererInfo
member.summary: A public class implementing this public interface can provide the data needed by a EffectBarRenderer to create effect glyphs dynamically.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.IEffectBarRendererInfo.EffectId
member.summary: Gets the unique effect name for this effect. (Used for grouping)

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.IEffectBarRendererInfo.CanShareBand
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this effect can share the space with other effects if required. (Example: tempo and dynamics don't share their space with other effects, a let-ring and palm-mute will share the space if possible)
member.returns: true if this effect bar should only be created once for the first track, otherwise false.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.IEffectBarRendererInfo.HideOnMultiTrack
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this effect glyphs should only be added once on the first track if multiple tracks are rendered. (Example: this allows to render the tempo changes only once)
member.returns: true if this effect bar should only be created once for the first track, otherwise false.

member.name: M:AlphaTab.Rendering.IEffectBarRendererInfo.ShouldCreateGlyph(AlphaTab.Settings,AlphaTab.Model.Beat)
member.summary: Checks whether the given beat has the appropriate effect set and needs a glyph creation
member.param: the beat storing the data
member.returns: true if the beat has the effect set, otherwise false.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.IEffectBarRendererInfo.SizingMode
member.summary: Gets the sizing mode of the glyphs created by this info.
member.returns: the sizing mode to apply to the glyphs during layout

member.name: M:AlphaTab.Rendering.IEffectBarRendererInfo.CreateNewGlyph(AlphaTab.Rendering.BarRendererBase,AlphaTab.Model.Beat)
member.summary: Creates a new effect glyph for the given beat.
member.param: the renderer which requests for glyph creation
the beat storing the data
member.returns: the glyph which needs to be added to the renderer

member.name: M:AlphaTab.Rendering.IEffectBarRendererInfo.CanExpand(AlphaTab.Model.Beat,AlphaTab.Model.Beat)
member.summary: Checks whether an effect glyph can be expanded to a particular beat.
member.param: the beat which already has the glyph applied
the beat which the glyph should get expanded to
member.returns: true if the glyph can be expanded, false if a new glyph needs to be created.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.Layout.HeaderFooterElements
member.summary: A list of the elements which can be shown in the header and footer of a rendered song sheet. All values can be combined using bit-operators as they are flags.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.Layout.HeaderFooterElements.None
member.summary: No elements get rendered.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.Layout.HeaderFooterElements.Title
member.summary: Enables rendering of the title.

member.summary: Enables rendering of the subtitle.

member.summary: Enables rendering of the artist.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.Layout.HeaderFooterElements.Album
member.summary: Enables rendering of the album.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.Layout.HeaderFooterElements.Words
member.summary: Enables rendering of the words.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.Layout.HeaderFooterElements.Music
member.summary: Enables rendering of the music.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.Layout.HeaderFooterElements.WordsAndMusic
member.summary: Enables rendering of the words and music.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.Layout.HeaderFooterElements.Copyright
member.summary: Enables rendering of the copyright.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.Layout.HeaderFooterElements.PageNumber
member.summary: Enables rendering of the page number.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.Layout.HeaderFooterElements.All
member.summary: Enables rendering of all elements.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.Layout.HorizontalScreenLayout
member.summary: This layout arranges the bars all horizontally

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.Layout.PageViewLayout
member.summary: This layout arranges the bars into a fixed width and dynamic height region.

member.name: M:AlphaTab.Rendering.Layout.PageViewLayout.FitGroup(AlphaTab.Rendering.Staves.StaveGroup)
member.summary: Realignes the bars in this line according to the available space

member.summary: This is the base public class for creating new layouting engines for the score renderer.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.RenderingResources
member.summary: This public class contains central definitions for controlling the visual appearance.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.ScoreBarRenderer
member.summary: This BarRenderer renders a bar using standard music notation.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.ScoreBarRenderer.SharpKsSteps
member.summary: The step offsets of sharp symbols for sharp key signatures.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.ScoreBarRenderer.FlatKsSteps
member.summary: The step offsets of sharp symbols for flat key signatures.

member.name: M:AlphaTab.Rendering.ScoreBarRenderer.GetScoreY(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Gets the relative y position of the given steps relative to first line.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.ScoreBarRendererFactory
member.summary: This Factory procudes ScoreBarRenderer instances

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.ScoreRenderer
member.summary: This is the main wrapper of the rendering engine which can render a single track of a score object into a notation sheet.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.Staves.BarLayoutingInfo
member.summary: This public class stores size information about a stave. It is used by the layout engine to collect the sizes of score parts to align the parts across multiple staves.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.Staves.BarLayoutingInfo.Version
member.summary: an internal version number that increments whenever a change was made.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.Staves.MasterBarsRenderers
member.summary: This container represents a single column of bar renderers independent from any staves. This container can be used to reorganize renderers into a new staves.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.Staves.Staff
member.summary: A Staff represents a single line within a StaveGroup. It stores BarRenderer instances created from a given factory.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.Staves.Staff.TrackIndex
member.summary: This is the index of the track being rendered. This is not the index of the track within the model, but the n-th track being rendered. It is the index of the array defining which tracks should be rendered. For single-track rendering this will always be zero.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.Staves.Staff.StaveTop
member.summary: This is the visual offset from top where the Staff contents actually start. Used for grouping using a accolade

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.Staves.Staff.StaveBottom
member.summary: This is the visual offset from top where the Staff contents actually ends. Used for grouping using a accolade

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.Staves.StaveGroup
member.summary: A Staff consists of a list of different staves and groups them using an accolade.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.Staves.StaveGroup.IsFull
member.summary: Indicates whether this line is full or not. If the line is full the bars can be aligned to the maximum width. If the line is not full the bars will not get stretched.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.Staves.StaveGroup.Width
member.summary: The width that the content bars actually need

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.TabBarRenderer
member.summary: This BarRenderer renders a bar using guitar tablature notation

member.summary: Gets the relative y position of the given steps relative to first line.
member.param: the amount of steps while 2 steps are one line

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.TabBarRendererFactory
member.summary: This Factory produces TabBarRenderer instances

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.Utils.AccidentalHelper
member.summary: This small utilty public class allows the assignment of accidentals within a desired scope.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.Utils.AccidentalHelper.KeySignatureLookup
member.summary: a lookup list containing an info whether the notes within an octave need an accidental rendered. the accidental symbol is determined based on the type of key signature.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.Utils.AccidentalHelper.AccidentalNotes
member.summary: Contains the list of notes within an octave have accidentals set.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.Utils.AccidentalHelper.StepsPerOctave
member.summary: We always have 7 steps per octave. (by a step the offsets inbetween score lines is meant, 0 steps is on the first line (counting from top) 1 steps is on the space inbetween the first and the second line

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.Utils.AccidentalHelper.OctaveSteps
member.summary: Those are the amount of steps for the different clefs in case of a note value 0 [Neutral, C3, C4, F4, G2]

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.Utils.AccidentalHelper.SharpNoteSteps
member.summary: The step offsets of the notes within an octave in case of for sharp keysignatures

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.Utils.AccidentalHelper.FlatNoteSteps
member.summary: The step offsets of the notes within an octave in case of for flat keysignatures

member.name: M:AlphaTab.Rendering.Utils.AccidentalHelper.ApplyAccidental(AlphaTab.Model.Note)
member.summary: Calculates the accidental for the given note and assignes the value to it. The new accidental type is also registered within the current scope

member.name: M:AlphaTab.Rendering.Utils.AccidentalHelper.ApplyAccidentalForValue(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Calculates the accidental for the given note value and assignes the value to it. The new accidental type is also registered within the current scope

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Rendering.Utils.BeamBarType
member.summary: Lists all types how two voices can be joined with bars.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.Utils.BeamBarType.Full
member.summary: Full Bar from current to next

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.Utils.BeamBarType.PartLeft
member.summary: A small Bar from current to previous

member.name: F:AlphaTab.Rendering.Utils.BeamBarType.PartRight
member.summary: A small bar from current to next

member.summary: stores the X-positions for beat indices

member.summary: the number of fingering indicators that will be drawn

member.name: P:AlphaTab.Rendering.Utils.BeamingHelper.HasTuplet
member.summary: an indicator whether any beat has a tuplet on it.

member.summary: the first min note within this group

member.name: M:AlphaTab.Rendering.Utils.BeamingHelper.IsPositionFrom(System.String,AlphaTab.Model.Beat)
member.summary: Returns whether the the position of the given beat, was registered by the staff of the given ID

member.name: M:AlphaTab.Rendering.Utils.PercussionMapper.MapNoteForDisplay(System.Int32)
member.summary: Maps the given note to a normal note value to place the note at the correct line on score notation

member.name: T:AlphaTab.BendMode
member.summary: Lists all modes on how bends should be handled.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.BendMode.GuitarPro
member.summary: Bends will be displayed and played as in GuitarPro. Note heads are shown after the bended note to show the target note. Playback will follow the defined BendPoints.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.BendMode.SongBook
member.summary: Bends will be displayed and played in a traditional SongBook manner. For bends additional grace beats are introduced. Bends are categorized into gradual and fast bends. - Gradual bends are indicated by beat text "grad" or "grad.". Bend will sound along the beat duration. - Fast bends are done right before the next note. If the next note is tied even on-beat of the next note.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.WhammyMode
member.summary: Lists all modes on how whammy bars should be handled.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.WhammyMode.GuitarPro
member.summary: Whammy Bars will be displayed and played as in GuitarPro.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.WhammyMode.SongBook
member.summary: Whammy Bars will be displayed and played in a traditional SongBook manner. - Dips are shown as simple annotation over the beats Whammy Bars are categorized into gradual and fast. - Gradual whammys are indicated by beat text "grad" or "grad.". Whammys will sound along the beat duration. - Fast whammys are done right the beat.

member.name: T:AlphaTab.FingeringMode
member.summary: Lists all modes on how fingerings should be displayed.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.FingeringMode.Score
member.summary: Fingerings will be shown in the standard notation staff.

member.name: F:AlphaTab.FingeringMode.SingleNoteEffectBand
member.summary: Fingerings will be shown in a effect band above the tabs in case they have only a single note on the beat.

member.name: P:AlphaTab.LayoutSettings.Mode
member.summary:
The layouting mode used to arrange the the notation.
page - Bars are aligned in rows using a fixed width
horizontal - Bars are aligned horizontally in one row

member.name: P:AlphaTab.LayoutSettings.AdditionalSettings
member.summary:
Additional layout mode specific settings. mode=page
barsPerRow - Limit the displayed bars per row, -1 for sized based limit (integer, default:-1)
start - The bar start index to start layouting with (integer: default: 0)
count - The amount of bars to render overall, -1 for all till the end (integer, default:-1)
hideInfo - Render the song information or not (boolean, default:false)
hideTuning - Render the tuning information or not (boolean, default:false)
hideTrackNames - Render the track names or not (boolean, default:false)
mode=horizontal
start - The bar start index to start layouting with (integer: default: 0)
count - The amount of bars to render overall, -1 for all till the end (integer, default:-1)
hideTrackNames - Render the track names or not (boolean, default:false)

member.name: P:AlphaTab.StaveSettings.Id
member.summary:
The stave profile name as it is registered in Default Profiles:
score-tab - Standard music notation and guitar tablature are rendered (default)
score - Only standard music notation is rendered
tab - Only guitar tablature is rendered

member.name: P:AlphaTab.StaveSettings.AdditionalSettings
member.summary:
Additional stave sspecific settings id=tab
rhythm - Renders rhythm beams to tablature notes

member.name: T:AlphaTab.Xml.XmlParser.XmlState
member.summary: faster than enum
